page.title: 13Leisure-River Avon
page.content: This section of the river is relatively unpolluted,being one of the prize rivers for coarse fishing:Chubb, Roach,Perch,Dace and Pike being among fish caught.The waters are so highly valued that nationwide competitions are regularly held on it's banks. The rivers present day usage is confined to pleasure craft,with marinas at both Evesham and Tewkesbury.A lock at Chadbury has recently been repaired by the Lower Navigation Trust. The Fladbury canoe club regularly uses this stretch of river for training;some of it's members gaining international recognition,and representing Britain in the Olympics.
